{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2983583,"name":"vargoose84","username":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-28T16:47:52.791Z","cooked":"

During our off-season, we built a mini-bot (18" x 18"). Each corner of this robot has 2 talon FX motors (yes, we’re testing out swerving). For our gyro, we are using navx-mxp mounted on the roborio located between all these motors.
As you maybe can surmise we are experiencing significant interference with our yaw angles and our best guess is the falcons are affecting them.

We know careful placement of the gyro can limit interference, once placement is chosen, is there any further way we can mitigate the magnetic interference we experience from the motors?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-12-28T16:59:36.865Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":315,"readers_count":314,"score":138.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":398425,"topic_slug":"mini-faraday-cages","display_username":"vargoose84","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/mini-faraday-cages/398425/1","custom_user_title":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2983597,"name":"Blake Bourque","username":"techplex","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/techplex/{size}/195570_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-28T17:37:23.854Z","cooked":"

We haven’t seen interference on our similarly constructed setup. We have found that the NavX has more drift than the Pidgeon IMU from CTRE.

http://www.ctr-electronics.com/gadgeteer-imu-module-pigeon.html

Can you describe more about the interference you are seeing? Possibly a graph of the gyro signal with the motors running but with the frame on blocks so it isn’t actually moving?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-12-28T17:37:23.854Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":65.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":398425,"topic_slug":"mini-faraday-cages","display_username":"Blake Bourque","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"http://www.ctr-electronics.com/gadgeteer-imu-module-pigeon.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Cross the Road Electronics","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12397,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Mentor 4909"},"post_url":"/t/mini-faraday-cages/398425/2","custom_user_title":"Lead Mentor 4909","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2983608,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-28T18:28:13.196Z","cooked":"

In general, it’s not a good bet to rely on the magnetometer for yaw. The gyro shouldn’t be affected by magnetic or electric fields, and the navX should automatically be using only this sensor when the magnetometer is seeing interference.

Try to reproduce the issue by rotating the robot by hand, to see if the motors really are making the difference here. If they are, use the navXUI utility to get an independent readout of what the sensor is seeing.

At 45 seconds things go kinda weird… Take a look at the gyro readings at the right of the screen.
I’ll see if I can replicate it turning by hand.

FWIW, that doesn’t match what I’d expect to see from issues with the magnetometer. I’d check to be sure you have the latest firmware for the sensor, then see if it shows up in navXUI.

yeah I tried the firmware thing last night as I was troubleshooting this issue.

Could static due to drive on carpet cause this? It doesn’t seem to happen right away, just after a few minutes of driving

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-12-28T19:36:55.932Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":213,"readers_count":212,"score":62.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":398425,"topic_slug":"mini-faraday-cages","display_username":"vargoose84","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/mini-faraday-cages/398425/6","custom_user_title":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2983630,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-28T19:55:34.718Z","cooked":"

It’s strange. My bet is some kind of S/W bug, now that you’ve confirmed F/W version. That’s why the navXUI output is of interest. If it is good => some kind of S/W bug; if it is bad => something strange on the sensor, but that GUI might help to expose the particulars.

You don’t have any code that tries to reinitialize the sensor or to set it’s output? The third possibility is that there is code that is messing with the sensor’s settings/zero/angle…

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-12-28T19:55:34.718Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":44.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":398425,"topic_slug":"mini-faraday-cages","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":30247,"username":"vargoose84","name":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mini-faraday-cages/398425/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2983780,"name":"vargoose84","username":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-29T05:16:09.985Z","cooked":"

I don’t know if this is the solution or not, but I THINK the interference was caused by the CAN cables resting on top of the navx. A stretch of an explanation or an actual possibility? Problem seems to have disappeared once I zip tied cables.

20211228_2313013024×4032 1.82 MB

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-12-29T05:16:09.985Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":41.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":398425,"topic_slug":"mini-faraday-cages","display_username":"vargoose84","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/a/8/a8b131e2c8863cc53917f8f29bd99d9fea3316a3.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14283,"username":"nuttle","name":"Allen Nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/mini-faraday-cages/398425/8","custom_user_title":"3630 Assistant Coach - Stampede Robotics","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2983798,"name":"philso","username":"philso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-12-29T06:49:31.443Z","cooked":"

Detecting the source of electrical interference is not easy, even when one has the appropriate probes and analyzers.

What is shown in your video is not likely to be electrical interference. The voltages in your robot are too low to be getting any sort of electric field coupling. Static electricity would cause a momentary spike in values lasting a fraction of a second, and should not cause the continuous rotation seen on the screen. Magnetic coupling occurs when there are high currents flowing which is typically the motor currents in a robot like this. The rotation in the display is occurring when the robot is stationary and the motors are not running so they are not drawing any current.

If moving the CAN wires actually solved the problem, it is more likely that there is a bad connection in the CAN bus wires or some other wires that were disturbed when you zip tied the CAN wires. The current flowing in the CAN bus wires is very low so their effect on nearby wires will be minimal and the wires are in the form of a twisted pair so the coupling efficiency to the outside world is also very low.

As someone else has suggested, it is most likely to be a software issue.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-12-29T06:49:31.443Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":67.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":398425,"topic_slug":"mini-faraday-cages","display_username":"philso","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15467,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mini-faraday-cages/398425/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2983965,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-29T19:48:25.040Z","cooked":"

I have to agree with @philso, although if you could make the problem come and go by moving the CAN wiring, it might help to pin things down. If the problem was consistently present, and is now reliably gone, something that has changed very likely explains things. It would be good to know, if for no other reason than to ensure the problem doesn’t come back. But, the symptoms really don’t seem to line up with any type of interference.

Do you know what was making the clicking noise? That’s something else that’s a bit off when the 'bot is sitting still… Is it the PID on drive or steering motors? Vibration can throw off a gyro. It could even be the case that wires bouncing on the gyro IC could cause some type of problem, but it’s kind of a stretch. If you can make it happen again, maybe see if you can damp any vibrations with your hand, and/or feel them at the gyro IC?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2021-12-29T19:48:25.040Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":106,"readers_count":105,"score":41.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":398425,"topic_slug":"mini-faraday-cages","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":30247,"username":"vargoose84","name":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mini-faraday-cages/398425/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2984011,"name":"vargoose84","username":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-29T21:06:37.995Z","cooked":"

The vibration is an overactive pid controller. Retuned to get rid of the jitter.
